intro: Alpinia boninsimensis, commonly known as the Bonin ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands in Japan. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender rhizomes and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces fragrant, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
